title: quarto vignettes
text: pkgdown turns articles directory quarto project temporarily adding _quarto.yml articles. can also add want control options quarto articles. , mix .qmd .Rmd files, ’ll need include following yaml RMarkdown can continue handle .Rmd files: setup-r-dependencies action automatically install Quarto GitHub Actions .qmd file present repository (see install-quarto parameter details).

title: quarto vignettes
text: setup-r-dependencies action automatically install Quarto GitHub Actions .qmd file present repository (see install-quarto parameter details).

title: quarto vignettes
text: Callouts currently supported (https://github.com/quarto-dev/quarto-cli/issues/9963). pkgdown assumes ’re using quarto vignette style, generally html format minimal: true. Specifically, HTML vignettes currently supported. can’t customise mermaid styles quarto mermaid themes. want change colours, ’ll need provide custom CSS shown quarto docs. pkgdown pass lang setting quarto, set available languages perfectly matched. Learn https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/language.html, including supply translations.

title: quarto vignettes
text: following sections demonstrate bunch useful quarto features can make sure work. title: Authors and Citation
text: Hernangómez D (2026). rogtemplate: 'pkgdown' Template 'rOpenGov' Packages. R package version 0.0.2.9100, https://ropengov.github.io/rogtemplate/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rogtemplate: 'pkgdown' Template for 'rOpenGov' Packages},   author = {Diego Hernangómez},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.2.9100},   url = {https://ropengov.github.io/rogtemplate/}, }

title: pkgdown Template for rOpenGov Packages
text: package pkgdown template adapted rOpenGov site. private template use core rOpenGov packages. Please don’t use code.

title: pkgdown Template for rOpenGov Packages
text: possible deploy pkgdown site along rogtemplate via CI (GitHub Actions) locally, provides control automatic.

what: Option A: Deploy using GitHub Actions
title: pkgdown Template for rOpenGov Packages
text: necessary install rogtemplate . First copy file .github/workflows/ folder. Next go YOUR_GITHUB_REPO>Settings>GitHub Pages deploy website gh-pages branch.

title: pkgdown Template for rOpenGov Packages
text: can install rogtemplate using r-universe: can use also remotes package: can use rog_actions_pkgdown_branch() setting action described deployment still performed GitHub action. building locally package docs folder use: Note rogtemplate::rog_add_template_pkgdown() creates _pkgdown.yml file (modify existing one) following lines: lines tells pkgdown use rogtemplate.
code: install.packages("rogtemplate",   repos = c("https://ropengov.r-universe.dev", "https://cloud.r-project.org") ) library(remotes) install_github("ropengov/rogtemplate", dependencies = TRUE) rogtemplate::rog_build()  # or you can use also  rogtemplate::rog_add_template_pkgdown() pkgdown::build_site() template:   bootstrap: 5   package: rogtemplate

title: pkgdown Template for rOpenGov Packages
text: Last step commit GitHub, wait GitHub action ends (case chose deploy way) deploy website via YOUR_GITHUB_REPO>Settings>GitHub Pages.

title: pkgdown Template for rOpenGov Packages
text: provide also additional extra functions creating badges logos, see Extras info.

what: Creates a GitHub action that deploys on gh-pages branch — rog_actions_pkgdown_branch
title: Creates a GitHub action that deploys on gh-pages branch — rog_actions_pkgdown_branch
text: GitHub action created build pkgdown package gh-pages branch repo.

title: Creates a GitHub action that deploys on gh-pages branch — rog_actions_pkgdown_branch
Creates a GitHub action that deploys on gh-pages branch — rog_actions_pkgdown_branch
text: pkg Path package. overwrite Overwrite action already present.

what: Configure rogtemplate for your pkgdown site — rog_add_template_pkgdown
title: Configure rogtemplate for your pkgdown site — rog_add_template_pkgdown
text: Add corresponding configuration _pkgdown.yml. present, create file pkgdown/_pkgdown.yml. also add corresponding lines .Rbuildignore.

title: Configure rogtemplate for your pkgdown site — rog_add_template_pkgdown
Configure rogtemplate for your pkgdown site — rog_add_template_pkgdown
text: also adds corresponding urls _pkgdown.yml file DESCRIPTION file present: https://ropengov.github.io/pkgname/ https://github.com/ropengov/pkgname

title: Configure rogtemplate for your pkgdown site — rog_add_template_pkgdown
code: # \dontrun{ rog_add_template_pkgdown() #> Error: No DESCRIPTION file found  # }

what: Add a rOpenGov badge to your README file — rog_badge_ropengov
title: Add a rOpenGov badge to your README file — rog_badge_ropengov
text: Add rOpenGov badge pointing https://ropengov.org/ README file:

title: Add a rOpenGov badge to your README file — rog_badge_ropengov
Add a rOpenGov badge to your README file — rog_badge_ropengov
text: install TRUE/FALSE. TRUE badge installed README.md/.Rmd. FALSE message Rmarkdown code displayed.

title: Add a rOpenGov badge to your README file — rog_badge_ropengov
text: markdown badge message markdown code pasted.

title: Add a rOpenGov badge to your README file — rog_badge_ropengov

what: Build your pkgdown website locally — rog_build
title: Build your pkgdown website locally — rog_build
text: wrapper pkgdown::build_site()

title: Build your pkgdown website locally — rog_build
Build your pkgdown website locally — rog_build
text: pkg Path package. ... Arguments passed rog_logo, pkgdown::build_site overwrite current logo overwritten? TRUE run usethis::use_logo(). favicons Logical, want create favicons pkgdown::build_favicons()? p_x x position package name p_y y position package name p_size font size package name examples Run examples? run_dont_run Run examples surrounded \dontrun? seed Seed used initialize random number generation order make article output reproducible. integer scalar NULL seed. lazy TRUE, rebuild articles reference pages source newer destination. preview TRUE, .na(preview) && interactive(), preview freshly generated section browser. devel Use development deployment process? TRUE, uses lighter-weight process suitable rapid iteration; run examples vignettes current process, load code pkgload::load_all(). FALSE, first install package temporary library, run examples vignettes new process. build_site() defaults devel = FALSE get high fidelity outputs building complete site; build_reference(), build_home() friends default devel = TRUE can rapidly iterate development. new_process TRUE, run build_site() separate process. enhances reproducibility ensuring nothing loaded current process affects build process. install TRUE, install package temporary library available vignettes. quiet FALSE, generate build messages build functions take quiet arguments.

title: Build your pkgdown website locally — rog_build
text: function call also rog_add_template_pkgdown() rog_logo().

title: Load rogtemplate fonts — rog_load_font
text: Load current font use rOpenGov, B612 Mono

title: Load rogtemplate fonts — rog_load_font
code: rog_load_font() #> B612 Mono font loaded #> [1] "B612 Mono"

what: Creates a logo for your rOpenGov package — rog_logo
title: Creates a logo for your rOpenGov package — rog_logo
text: Creates logo automatically hexSticker::sticker(). Optionally, create also favicons pkgdown::build_favicons().

title: Creates a logo for your rOpenGov package — rog_logo
code: rog_logo(   pkgname,   filename = "man/figures/logo.png",   p_x = 1,   p_y = 1,   p_size = 202.6 * nchar(pkgname)^-1.008,   overwrite = FALSE,   favicons = TRUE )

title: Creates a logo for your rOpenGov package — rog_logo
text: pkgname Name package. present autodetected function. filename filename save sticker p_x x position package name p_y y position package name p_size font size package name overwrite current logo overwritten? TRUE run usethis::use_logo(). favicons Logical, want create favicons pkgdown::build_favicons()?

title: Creates a logo for your rOpenGov package — rog_logo
code: tmp <- tempfile(fileext = ".png") rog_logo("test a package", tmp, overwrite = FALSE, favicons = FALSE) #> B612 Mono font loaded #> Logo created on /tmp/RtmpoMsrRL/file1f4853df76b4.png  # Display logo <- magick::image_read(tmp)  logo #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   format width height colorspace matte filesize density #>   <chr>  <int>  <int> <chr>      <lgl>    <int> <chr>   #> 1 PNG      518    600 sRGB       TRUE     32127 118x118  plot(logo)

title: rOpenGov color palettes — rog_pals
text: Color palettes based color scheme rOpenGov

title: rOpenGov color palettes — rog_pals
code: rog_orange_pal(n = 4, alpha = 0.9, rev = FALSE)  rog_dark_pal(n = 4, alpha = 0.9, rev = FALSE)  rog_gradient_pal(n = 4, alpha = 0.9, rev = FALSE)  rog_qualitative_pal(n = 6, alpha = 0.9, rev = FALSE)

title: rOpenGov color palettes — rog_pals
text: n number colors (\(\ge 1\))     palette. alpha alpha-transparency level range [0,1]     (0 means transparent 1 means opaque), see argument     alpha hsv hcl, respectively.     missing, .e., explicitly specified     alpha equivalent alpha = NULL,     add opacity codes ("FF") individual color hex codes. rev logical indicating whether ordering colors     reversed.

title: rOpenGov color palettes — rog_pals
text: Color palettes

title: rogtemplate: 'pkgdown' Template for 'rOpenGov' Packages — rogtemplate-package
text: private template use core rOpenGov packages. Please don’t use code.

title: rogtemplate: 'pkgdown' Template for 'rOpenGov' Packages — rogtemplate-package
text: Maintainer: Diego Hernangómez diego.hernangomezherrero@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder] contributors: Steph Buongiorno steph.buon@gmail.com (ORCID) [contributor]

title: rogtemplate 0.0.2.9000
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added palette functions, see rog_orange_pal(). Adapt bslib >= 0.6.1 changes Bootstrap v5.3.1. New dark mode added.
